texts.value_en: If a unit consists of a large number of models, it is far more convenient when moving it around to place a ‘movement tray’ underneath it – that way you effectively have a single object to move on the battlefield rather than a large number of them (say 20 Elf infantry models). This speeds up gameplay immensely. The ideal movement tray is a piece of plastic, thick cardboard or plasticard that is cut to the exact space occupied by the bases of the models forming the unit, and painted to match the colour of their bases. For example, a regiment of 20 Elf infantry models occupies a rectangular tray 100mm wide and 80mm deep. If the tray has a little ‘lip’ around the unit (normally up to a couple of millimetres wide), this does not matter and players should ignore the lip when measuring distances.
texts.value_translated: Si une unité est composée d’un grand nombre de figurines, il est bien plus pratique de la déplacer en mettant un 'plateau de mouvement' en dessous – cela permet de déplacer un seul élément sur le champ de bataille au lieu de manipuler individuellement chaque figurine (par exemple, 20 figurines d’infanterie elfique). Cela accélère énormément le jeu. L’idéal est d’utiliser une plaque de plastique, de carton épais ou de plasticard découpée aux dimensions exactes de l’espace occupé par les socles des figurines formant l’unité, et peinte pour s’accorder à la couleur de leurs socles. Par exemple, un régiment de 20 figurines d’infanterie elfique occupe un plateau rectangulaire de 100mm de large sur 80mm de profondeur. Si le plateau comporte un léger rebord (habituellement de quelques millimètres de large), cela n’a pas d’importance et les joueurs doivent l’ignorer lors des mesures de distance.

texts.value_en: If a unit decides to Counter Charge, then it may only do so against an Enemy unit with which it is already Engaged. It does not need LoS and the Enemy unit does not need to be in the front arc, so it may Counter Charge against units Engaged on its flank or rear facings.
texts.value_translated: Si une unité décide d'effectuer une Contre-Charge, elle ne peut le faire que contre une unité ennemie avec laquelle elle est déjà engagée. Il n'est pas nécessaire d'avoir une ligne de vue et l'unité ennemie n'a pas besoin d'être dans l'arc frontal, donc l'unité peut effectuer une Contre-Charge contre des unités engagées sur ses flancs ou ses arrières.

texts.value_en: If a unit has [n] after its name in the list, it is only available in limited numbers and may only be taken in quantities up to its [n] value. Often these are named heroes of great fame or units of renown and so have a [1] against their name as they are unique. Such units are often known as “Living Legends”.

If a unit has multiple instances of the same special rule, these have no additional effect. If a unit has two or more instances of the same special rule with an (n) value, the controlling player must choose which (n) value they wish to use. In some instances, upgrades or special abilities or spells may grant a special rule with a (+n) value. If the unit does not already have that special rule, the unit would then have it with the given (n) value. If it does already have the special rule, the unit’s (n) value is increased by the (+n) value, up to the maximum allowed by the rules.
texts.value_translated: Si une unité possède plusieurs instances de la même règle spéciale, celles-ci n'ont aucun effet supplémentaire. Si une unité possède deux ou plusieurs instances de la même règle spéciale avec une valeur (n), le joueur contrôleur doit choisir la valeur (n) qu'il souhaite utiliser. Dans certains cas, des améliorations, des capacités spéciales ou des sorts peuvent accorder une règle spéciale avec une valeur (+n). Si l'unité ne possède pas déjà cette règle spéciale, elle l'acquerra alors avec la valeur (n) donnée. Si elle possède déjà cette règle spéciale, la valeur (n) de l'unité sera augmentée de la valeur (+n), jusqu'à la limite maximale autorisée par les règles.

texts.value_en: If a unit inside the Courtyard starts its Turn in base contact with the front wall section it may move through the gate. Pick up the unit and place it so that its rear edge is in contact with the outside wall of the castle. It may then receive a normal move order. A unit inside the Courtyard may also charge out of the gate if it starts its Turn in base contact with, and facing, the front wall. Draw line of sight and range from the centre of the outside of the gate then place the charging unit so that its entire rear facing is in base contact with the gate, and then finally move it using the usual rules for charging. Charges through the gate in this manner are considered to be over an obstacle. If an Attacker’s unit is in base contact with the outside of the gate, then one defending unit may declare a charge against it, providing it is able to move into base contact and align with the inside of the gate. A unit that charges in this manner may be countercharged as the gate is considered open during the Melee.

If a unit is damaged by the ranged attacks of one or more units with this rule, add one to the subsequent Nerve test at the end of the Ranged phase. If an enemy unit is subject to both the Shattering and Dread special rules, the attacking player must choose to use either the Shattering or the Dread modifiers. Both cannot be applied against the same unit.

If a unit that begins its turn on a hill makes a Charge that is not Hindered against a unit that is not on a hill, the charging unit gains the Thunderous Charge (+1) special rule. Units with the Fly special rule, including those who have temporarily lost the special rule due to being Disordered, do not gain this bonus.
texts.value_translated: Si une unité qui commence son tour sur une colline effectue une Charge qui n'est pas Gênée contre une unité qui n'est pas sur une colline, l'unité chargeante obtient la règle spéciale Charge Fracassante (+1). Les unités ayant la règle spéciale Vol, y compris celles ayant temporairement perdu cette règle en raison d'un Désordre, ne bénéficient pas de ce bonus.

texts.value_en: If a unit that starts its turn Garrisoning a wall section wishes to move to the Courtyard, pick it up and place it so that its base is in contact with the vacated wall section. The unit may not be given any further movement orders that Turn. A unit that is Garrisoning a section of wall may only face outwards away from the castle or inwards towards the Courtyard. During the Move Phase, the unit may Change Facing! to reverse its current facing.

If a unit with a [n] value has more than one unit size available (e.g. Troop and Regiment), each unit taken, regardless of size, counts toward the [n] total. For instance, a unit with both Troops and Regiments that is [3] may not take 3 Troops and 3 Regiments.

If a unit with this rule begins its turn Wavering, roll a die before declaring a Movement order (including Halt) for this unit. On a 3+ it shrugs off the effects of Wavering and is Disordered instead. Adjust any counters on the unit as required.
If a unit’s Leader Point is in a piece of Difficult Terrain, then that unit ignores that piece of Difficult Terrain when checking LoS. Otherwise Difficult Terrain impacts LoS as described below.
texts.value_translated: Si le Point de Leader d'une unité se trouve dans un terrain difficile, cette unité ignore ce terrain difficile lorsqu'elle vérifie la ligne de vue. Sinon, le terrain difficile impacte la ligne de vue comme décrit ci-dessous.

texts.value_en: If a unit’s Leader Point is on a hill, but the unit itself is not on the hill (with more than half its base), LoS is not blocked, but the hill itself is taken into consideration when determining if a unit is an Obscured Target.
If a unit’s Leader Point is on a hill, then that unit ignores that hill when checking LoS. Otherwise, hills impact LoS as described below.
texts.value_translated: Si le point de leader d'une unité se trouve sur une colline, cette unité ignore cette colline lors de la vérification de la ligne de vue. Sinon, les collines influencent la ligne de vue comme décrit ci-dessous.

texts.value_en: If an Individual suffers a Rout result, and the attacking unit(s) opts to advance D6” directly forward for its Regroup move, it may make contact with another enemy unit if the distance moved would allow it. This is treated as a successful Charge against the facing that has been contacted. If, and only if, the advancing unit contacts a corner of the enemy unit and not the edge, determine which arc of the enemy unit the Leader Point of the advancing unit is in before it moves and align to that facing. The charging unit is aligned and shuffled against the new enemy as normal and can immediately attack again, even if the unit contacted has already been attacked in Melee this Turn. This may result in more than one Nerve test on a single enemy unit in the Melee phase. If either the initial Charge move or the regroup move took the charging unit over an Obstacle or through Difficult Terrain, then it is Hindered during this additional combat.
texts.value_translated: Si un Indépendant est mis en Déroute, et que l’unité attaquante (ou les unités attaquantes) choisit d’avancer de D6” en avant pour son mouvement de Regroupement, elle peut entrer en contact avec une autre unité ennemie si la distance parcourue le permet. Cela est considéré comme une Charge réussie contre le côté qui a été touché. Si, et seulement si, l’unité en mouvement entre en contact avec un coin de l’unité ennemie et non avec son bord, déterminez quel arc de l’unité ennemie le Point Leader de l’unité en mouvement se trouve avant qu’elle ne se déplace, puis alignez-le avec ce côté. L’unité qui charge est ensuite alignée et déplacée contre la nouvelle unité ennemie comme d’habitude et peut immédiatement attaquer à nouveau, même si l’unité touchée a déjà été attaquée en mêlée durant ce Tour. Cela peut entraîner plusieurs tests de Moral sur une même unité ennemie durant la phase de mêlée. Si le mouvement initial de Charge ou le mouvement de regroupement a amené l’unité chargée au-dessus d’un Obstacle ou à travers un Terrain Difficile, l’unité est Gênée lors de ce combat supplémentaire.

texts.value_en: If any successes are rolled, until the start of your following Turn, when attacking in melee, the target may make a number of additional attacks equal to the casters Spellcaster tier plus 2. These attacks are rolled separately to their normal attacks and always hit on a 3+, with the Crushing Strength (3)Special Rule. These attacks are never doubled, tripled or affected by artefacts, spells or any other special rules. A spellcaster may cast host shadowbeast onto themselves and can do so even when engaged with an enemy unit. Multiple castings on the same target have no additional effect.
If any units or terrain in the way are the same Height or greater than both your unit and the target unit, then LoS is blocked.
texts.value_translated: Si des unités ou des éléments de terrain sur le chemin ont une Taille égale ou supérieure à celle de votre unité et de l'unité cible, alors la ligne de vue est bloquée.

texts.value_en: If at the end of the game you have a Scoring unit within at least 3” of an Objective and there are no enemy units within 3” of it, you control that Objective. A single unit can control any number of Objectives.
texts.value_translated: Si, à la fin de la partie, vous avez une unité de prise d'objectif à moins de 3” d'un objectif et qu'il n'y a aucune unité ennemie à moins de 3” de celui-ci, vous contrôlez cet objectif. Une seule unité peut contrôler plusieurs objectifs.

texts.value_en: If both players have an equal total Unit Strength within 3” of an Objective, then it is contested and is worth 0 Victory Points for both players.
texts.value_translated: Si les deux joueurs ont une Puissance d'Unité Totale égale à moins de 3” d'un objectif, celui-ci est contesté et ne rapporte aucun Point de Victoire à aucun des joueurs.

texts.value_en: If both players have units that allow redeployment, roll off to decide which players goes first, and then alternate any units to be redeployed.
texts.value_translated: Si les deux joueurs possèdent des unités permettant un redéploiement, lancez un dé pour déterminer lequel commence, puis alternez le redéploiement des unités.

texts.value_en: If either your unit or the target unit has a greater Height stat than any other units or terrain in the way, then LoS is not blocked.
texts.value_translated: Si votre unité ou l'unité cible a une statistique de Taille plus élevée que toute autre unité ou élément de terrain sur le chemin, alors la ligne de vue n'est pas bloquée.

texts.value_en: If more than one unit is attacking the same target, resolve steps 1 and 2 for each unit in the order chosen by the attacking player before moving on to step 3. Regardless of the number of attacking units, the target’s nerve is only tested once in a given combat.
If multiple units are touching a single pile then each unit may take a single token.

If necessary, at any point during this move, the unit may perform a single pivot around their centre of up to 90º. This pivot should be performed at the earliest possible point during the move in order to make it a legal charge, while also pivoting the smallest amount required which will allow it to make contact with the correct enemy facing with the remaining movement. see Diagram M.
texts.value_translated: Si nécessaire, à n'importe quel moment durant ce mouvement, l'unité peut effectuer un seul pivot autour de son centre d'un maximum de 90º. Ce pivot doit être effectué le plus tôt possible pendant le mouvement afin de rendre la charge légale, tout en effectuant le pivot du plus petit angle nécessaire qui permettra de faire le contact avec le bon côté de l'ennemi avec le mouvement restant. Voir le Diagramme M.

texts.value_en: If one of your units is Routed while carrying Loot, place the Counter(s) anywhere within its footprint before removing the unit. If the unit was destroyed in a Melee, your opponent automatically distributes the Loot Counters however they like among the units that are in contact with yours before your unit is removed.
texts.value_translated: Si l'une de vos unités est en Déroute et qu'elle porte un butin, placez le(s) jeton(s) de butin n'importe où dans sa zone occupée avant de retirer l'unité. Si l'unité a été détruite lors d'un corps à corps, votre adversaire distribue automatiquement les jetons de butin comme il le souhaite parmi les unités en contact avec la vôtre avant que votre unité ne soit retirée.

texts.value_en: If one or more hits are scored, for the rest of the turn the unit gains Crushing Strength (+1). This effect only applies once – multiple castings on the same target have no additional effect.
If one or more hits are scored, the spellcaster gains the Aura (Stealthy) special rule until the start of the player’s next Turn.

If one or more hits are scored, the target unit has a -1 modifier when rolling to damage enemy units during their next Turn (any rolls the unit makes of a natural 6 will still cause damage, however). Multiple castings of this spell, or combining it with Weakness, do not cause additional modifiers. Additionally, for each hit scored, roll a single D3 and total the results. This total is the amount of attacks to roll for damaging the target.
If one or more hits are scored, until the start of its next Turn, the target increases its Waver and Rout stat values by 1 and gains the Rallying (+1) special rule, to a maximum of 2.

If one or more hits are successfully scored, during the following Turn any charges made by the target unit will be Hindered. In addition, the target unit cannot use the Strider and Pathfinder special rules for the duration of its next Turn.
If one or more points of damage are scored with this unit’s attack, the damaged enemy unit is given the Frozen Special Rule.
If the Leader Point of the charging unit is in the target’s front arc when the order to Charge is given, the unit must charge the target’s front facing.
texts.value_translated: Si le point de leader de l'unité qui charge se trouve dans l'arc frontal de la cible lorsque l'ordre de charge est donné, l'unité doit charger la face avant de la cible.

texts.value_en: If the Leader Point of the charging unit is in the target’s rear arc when the order to Charge is given, the unit must charge the target’s rear facing. See Diagram H.
texts.value_translated: Si le point de leader de l'unité qui charge se trouve dans l'arc arrière de la cible lorsque l'ordre de charge est donné, l'unité doit charger l'arrière de la cible. Voir le Diagramme H.

texts.value_en: If the Leader Point of the charging unit is in the target’s right or left flank arc when the order to Charge is given, the unit must charge the target’s corresponding flank facing.
texts.value_translated: Si le point de leader de l'unité qui charge se trouve dans l'arc de flanc droit ou gauche de la cible lorsque l'ordre de charge est donné, l'unité doit charger le flanc correspondant de la cible.

texts.value_en: If the attacking unit Counter Charges an enemy Engaged on its side or rear facing, simply pick up the Counter Charging unit, turn it to face the target and align it flush with the target’s front face. Shuffle it to the final position as normal. As noted above, the unit is now Disengaged from all other units it was previously Engaged with. Nudge them out of contact as above.
texts.value_translated: Si l'unité attaquante effectue une Contre-Charge contre une unité ennemie engagée sur son flanc ou son arrière, il suffit de soulever l'unité effectuant la Contre-Charge, de la tourner pour faire face à la cible et de l'aligner contre la face avant de la cible. Déplacez-la ensuite jusqu'à sa position finale comme d'habitude. Comme mentionné ci-dessus, l'unité est désormais Dégagée de toutes les autres unités avec lesquelles elle était auparavant engagée. Écartez-les un peu pour montrer qu'elles ne sont plus engagées.

texts.value_en: If the other player still has time remaining, then they may continue playing as normal.
If the total is equal to or higher than the unit’s Routing limit, the unit suffers a Rout result (see below).
If the total is lower than the Routing limit, but equal to or higher than the Wavering limit, the unit suffers a Wavering result (see below).
If the total is lower than the unit’s Wavering limit, then the unit is said to be Steady, which means it is completely unaffected and continues to fight on as normal.

If the unit Counter Charges an enemy unit that is Engaged on its front facing, simply shuffle the attacking unit to its final position as normal. It is now considered Disengaged from all other units, so, if possible, any units it may still be touching should be nudged out of contact to show that they are no longer Engaged.
texts.value_translated: Si l'unité effectue une Contre-Charge contre une unité ennemie engagée sur son face avant, il suffit de décaler l'unité attaquante jusqu'à sa position finale comme d'habitude. L'unité est désormais considérée comme Dégagée de toutes les autres unités, donc, si possible, toute unité qu'elle pourrait encore toucher devrait être légèrement écartée pour montrer qu'elle n'est plus engagée.

texts.value_en: If the unit’s attack hits the target, the target suffers a number of hits equal to the number in brackets, rather than a single hit. Once this is done, roll damage as normal for all of this hits caused.
If this imaginary line passes over no other unit’s base or terrain features, then LoS is not blocked.
texts.value_translated: Si cette ligne imaginaire ne passe pas au-dessus d'une autre unité ou d'éléments de terrain, la ligne de vue n'est pas bloquée.

texts.value_en: If this unit is Steady as a result of a Nerve test, it regains (n) points of damage previously suffered to a maximum of 3. If no value is specified, the unit has Iron Resolve (1).
If this unit is within 12” of an enemy unit with the Inspiring or Very Inspiring special rule and it is Routed, the opponent must re-roll that Nerve test. The second result stands.

If this unit, or any Friendly Core unit within 6inches of this unit, suffers a Rout result, the opponent must re-roll that Nerve test. The second result stands. Note that a unit may also have a qualifier for its Inspiring rule. In this case the unit will only Inspire itself and the unit(s) specified.

If two opposing units are in adjoining wall sections, then a charge may be declared. Line of sight is not required, and the units are not actually moved, as this may require you to balance them in precarious positions!
If you are enjoying these rules as part of a free subscription, we recommend you read

If you are playing on a size other than 6’x4’, then you may need to adjust the scenario. Usually this will mean reducing the number of objectives. We have detailed the recommended changes for a 4’x4’ board within the applicable scenarios. Please ensure that both players are aware of the changes being used for each scenario when necessary.

If you are using a Theme List, you may only select the specified units from the Master List indicated. Other units from the Master List may not be taken. Likewise, any army upgrades available to the Master List are only available to the Theme List if explicitly mentioned in the Theme List itself.

If you are using a table where the length is not a multiple of 6, you may wish to proportionally increase the number of objectives used. For example, a table that is 9’ by 4’, is 50% longer than a standard table, and as such, you may wish to increase the number of objectives used by 50%, rounding down.

If you are using allies, then you may only choose up to 25% of your army total points limit from the allied list. You may not take Irregular or Limited units as allies and you cannot select the same allied unit entry of each of the following types more than once:
If you do choose to include allies in your army, we recommend that the following restrictions apply.

If you don’t have a chess clock at hand, don’t worry – the stopwatch in your phone or watch, or even an hourglass or egg timer will do fine. If you use one of these, then each player gets an agreed amount of time per Turn (agree first how many Rounds the game is going to last for). We suggest that each Turn should take around two minutes per 500 points in your game (say eight minutes in a 2000 point game).
If you roll double six when testing Nerve and the enemy unit is not Routed, it will still suffer from a result of Wavering, as insidious news of defeat starts to spread through the ranks.

If you roll snake eyes (double one) when testing Nerve, the enemy unit is filled with implacable resolve and will always be Steady and fight on, regardless of any modifier. Note, if the Enemy unit has suffered enough damage, this may still result in it being Devastated.

If your opponent also has a Scoring unit within 3” of an objective, then you can determine who controls it by adding up the total Unit Strength of both your and your opponents units within 3” of the Objective. Whichever army has the highest total is in control of that Objective Marker.
texts.value_translated: Si votre adversaire a également une unité pouvant prendre un objectif à moins de 3” d'un objectif, vous pouvez déterminer qui le contrôle en additionnant la Puissance d'Unité Totale des unités de votre armée et de celle de votre adversaire présentes à moins de 3” de l'objectif. L'armée ayant la Puissance d'Unité Totale la plus élevée contrôle cet objectif.

texts.value_en: If your unit is attacking an enemy to its flank, it doubles its Attacks. If your unit is attacking an enemy to its rear, it triples its Attacks.
If your unit is not Engaged but begins its Turn within 1” of an Enemy unit, it may still move freely as long as it ends its Turn no closer to the Enemy unit than where it began.
texts.value_translated: Si votre unité n'est pas engagée mais commence son tour à moins de 1” d'une unité ennemie, elle peut toujours se déplacer librement tant qu'elle ne termine pas son tour plus près de l'unité ennemie qu'elle ne l'était au début.

texts.value_en: If you’re unsure whether your unit can see a target unit or not, roll a die. On a 4+ it can see it, on 3 or less it cannot.
texts.value_translated: Si vous n'êtes pas sûr que votre unité puisse voir une unité cible ou non, lancez un dé. Sur un résultat de 4 ou plus, elle peut la voir, sur 3 ou moins, elle ne peut pas.

texts.value_en: If, on the other hand, your unit(s) failed to Rout the Enemy unit, it remains Engaged. Engaged units remain in base contact with one another and do not move.

Immediately after casting a spell, the unit may cast a different spell, but must choose a different target unit. After resolving the second spell casting, this unit may not cast any spells during its following Turn.

Immediately before being issued a Movement order, Individuals may pivot to face any direction before carrying out the rest of their order. If it is a Charge order, this pivot is allowed to end within 1” of enemy units.
texts.value_translated: Immédiatement avant de recevoir un ordre de Mouvement, les Indépendants peuvent pivoter pour faire face à n'importe quelle direction avant d'exécuter le reste de leur ordre. Si c'est un ordre de Charge, ce pivot est autorisé à se terminer à moins de 1” des unités ennemies.

texts.value_en: In Kings of War, all units are made up of one or more models. The number of models that make up a unit is specified in each unit’s stats and will normally correspond to the number of models you get in boxes supplied by Mantic. These models must be attached to bases and formed up into their units as described below and each unit belongs to one of the following Types:
texts.value_translated: Dans Kings of War, toutes les unités sont composées d'une ou plusieurs figurines. Le nombre de figurines qui composent une unité est spécifié dans les statistiques de chaque unité et correspond normalement au nombre de figurines incluses dans les boîtes fournies par Mantic. Ces figurines doivent être fixées sur des socles et organisées en unités comme décrit ci-dessous, chaque unité appartenant à l'un des types suivants :

texts.value_en: In Legendary games where the points limit for each side is 4000 or more, if any Allies are taken it is referred to as a Grand Alliance. The maximum amount of points that can be spent on Allies in a Grand Alliance is up to 50% of the total points limit.

In Legendary games where the points limit for each side is 4000 or more, players may choose to take Colossal Titans, Rare Monsters and Epic Units. These units are both unique, and irregular, so only one of each type may be included in an army, and must be unlocked using the usual army list building rules.
In Melee, this unit will always damage the enemy on a 4+ regardless of any other modifiers.

In a Grand Alliance, the allied force may also select magical artefacts, however you still may not select the same artefact twice for the Grand Alliance as a whole. Irregular units, Unique units and Formations may also be taken by the allied force. Additionally, allies may target units in the Core force with spells, and vice versa, and the Inspiring Special rule will affect all Friendly units, instead of just Core units.
In a similar way to a unit, a castle wall section has stats and a profile. The default profile for a section of wall is:

In a standard 2000 point game, players may only take the same Hero, Monster, Titan or War Engine unit a maximum of three times. Elves could take a maximum of three Bolt Thrower units in 2000 points for example. This limit includes units with artefacts or other upgrades, so an Undead army could only have a maximum of 3 Necromancers, regardless of what options or upgrades they take.

In a standard game, players will pick from a single Army List. However, sometimes players wish to play an army with a particular story or theme and so may wish to add allies from another list to their army.

In addition to the spells listed on their profile, a non-Living Legend (limited) unit with a spellcaster tier of 1 or more may purchase spells from the Library of Arcane Knowledge below. Any army may purchase each spell listed in the library once, and for a unit in addition to any artefacts or other selections on that unit’s profile (including optional upgrades) that are available.
In addition, after deployment is finished, the defender may deploy 2 additional 6” obstacle pieces of terrain touching the edge of the defender’s deployment zone in any fashion.
In addition, the unit gains both the Fury and Headstrong special rules.
In addition, units do not need to Disengage to carry out a ranged attack if they are only Engaged with Individuals that are Yielding.
texts.value_translated: De plus, les unités n'ont pas besoin de se désengager pour effectuer une attaque à distance si elles ne sont engagées qu'avec des Indépendants qui Cèdent leur place.

texts.value_en: In addition, when this unit routs an enemy unit in melee, it can Overrun as if it had routed an individual, adding +1 to the D6 result. (See Overrun on page 40 of the Rulebook).
In all scenarios requiring the deployment of Loot tokens or Objective markers, the tokens and markers should be placed at least 9” apart rather than the 12” outlined in the scenarios section.
In cases when the target unit is partially visible behind another unit or terrain piece, they are considered to be an Obscured Target. An Obscured Target is classed as being in Cover.
In cases where a unit has sought shelter within terrain, a target unit is considered to be a Concealed Target. A Concealed Target is classed as being in Cover.

In cases where multiple units charge one facing, but other units are charging a different facing, the units on each facing must still share the available frontage as evenly as possible, as described above, but if possible, they will still try to accommodate chargers on other facings. See Diagram Q.
texts.value_translated: Dans les cas où plusieurs unités chargent une même face, mais que d'autres unités chargent une face différente, les unités sur chaque face doivent toujours partager la largeur disponible aussi uniformément que possible, comme décrit ci-dessus, mais si possible, elles essaieront toujours d'accommoder les unités chargeant d'autres faces. Voir le Diagramme Q.

texts.value_en: In games between 750-995 points, no unit may cost more than 250 points (including any magical artefacts, upgrades, or purchased spells).

In games of Kings of War, players field armies of painted Mantic miniatures to fight exciting battles across the tabletop! Combat and abilities are represented by a unit’s statistics (called stats for short) and by rolling six-sided dice (called D6 for short) to decide your warriors’ fates.
texts.value_translated: Dans les parties de Kings of War, les joueurs déploient des armées de figurines Mantic peintes pour livrer des batailles passionnantes sur la table de jeu ! Le combat et les capacités sont représentés par les statistiques d’une unité (appelées stats en abrégé) et par des jets de dés à six faces (D6 en abrégé) pour déterminer le destin de vos guerriers.

texts.value_en: In games under 750 points per side, no unit may cost more than 200 points (including any magical artefacts, upgrades, or purchased spells).

In order to achieve this, you and your opponent must pick an army before the game. Armies are selected from the Army Lists (sometimes called Force Lists) presented later in this book. Units within an army each have a Points Value assigned to them, which represents their value on the battlefield. Bigger units and those that can deal more damage will typically have a higher Points Value than smaller or weaker units. Players will select the units for their army by ‘spending’ points up to an agreed limit.

In order to avoid confusion, keep your units at least 1” away from enemy units at all times, except when charging, engaged or regrouping as explained later. To remove any confusion, ensure that your units are not in base contact with other friendly units at all times.
texts.value_translated: Afin d'éviter toute confusion, gardez vos unités à au moins 1 pouce de distance des unités ennemies à tout moment, sauf lorsqu'elles chargent, sont engagées au combat ou se regroupent comme expliqué plus tard. Pour éviter toute confusion, assurez-vous que vos unités ne soient pas en contact socle à socle avec d'autres unités amies à tout moment.

texts.value_en: In order to be on a hill for game purposes, a unit must have at least half of its unit’s base on it. When a player intends for their unit to be on a hill, they should make this clear to their opponent.
texts.value_translated: Pour être considérée comme étant sur une colline dans le cadre du jeu, une unité doit avoir au moins la moitié de sa surface d'unité dessus. Lorsqu'un joueur souhaite que son unité soit sur une colline, il doit le faire savoir clairement à son adversaire.

texts.value_en: In order to keep these forces fair and balanced, there are a few restrictions on how you can field Theme Lists.

In order to restrict the possible (nasty) combinations that can be fielded and to make sure armies have a semblance of ‘realism’ about them, we introduce the following limitations to the unit types that can make up your army.

In reality, regimented units are more flexible in rearranging their ranks and files than our miniatures, so when a unit is pivoting around its centre, it can pivot through both friends and enemy units, and all types of terrain, including Blocking Terrain and the edge of the table. It must of course still end its pivot (and also its entire move) clear of Blocking Terrain (and completely on the table), not in base contact with Friendly units, and at least 1” away from Enemy units.
texts.value_translated: Dans la réalité, les unités en formation sont plus flexibles pour réarranger leurs troupes que nos figurines. Ainsi, lorsqu'une unité pivote autour de son centre, elle peut pivoter à travers des unités amies et ennemies, ainsi que tout type de terrain, y compris le terrain Bloquant et le bord de la table. Elle doit cependant terminer son pivot (et également son mouvement complet) hors du terrain Bloquant (et entièrement sur la table), sans être en contact avec des unités Amies, et à au moins 1 pouce des unités Ennemies.

texts.value_en: In some rare cases, the only possible way for charging units to make physical contact with a target would be by literally having one corner of its frontage in contact with one corner of the target.
texts.value_translated: Dans de rares cas, la seule façon pour les unités qui chargent d'entrer en contact avec une cible serait d'avoir seulement un coin de leur face avant en contact avec un coin de la cible.

texts.value_en: In subsequent Defender turns, roll for each unit in reserve again. The score needed to emerge from the tunnel is lowered by one each Turn (so 3+ in turn 3, 2+ in turn 4). A dice roll of a 1 always fails and cannot be re-rolled. If an enemy unit is covering the tunnel exit marker when the unit emerges, consider this as a front charge by the emerging unit and place the unit in base contact with the enemy unit’s front. If there is no room to place a unit emerging from a tunnel, it must stay in reserve and roll again next Turn. If the unit is unable to emerge from the tunnel before the game ends it is considered Routed.

Once you have finished moving all of your units, it’s time to make ranged attacks with those that can do so. texts.value_en: One of the things we always intended to reintroduce to the game was the concept of Formations. We know many players will be excited for this! Formations are thematic groups of units that, when taken and used together, gain certain bonuses during a game. This represents the units being especially effective in combination, or having years of training and experience working and fighting together. They are also a great excuse for modelling and naming your units, and building stories around them.

Then players alternate placing a pile of 2 Loot Counters each along the centre line, rolling off to see who places their pile first. One use only. This upgrade is given to a single wall section, but can only be activated when the wall section is Garrisoned. Instead of declaring a countercharge using their own profile, a unit Garrisoning a wall section with this upgrade, may declare it is activating the trap as its order for the Turn. In the following Melee phase, the trap inflicts 2D6 hits on every attacking unit that charged the wall section or Garrisoning unit in the previous turn. Hits are calculated at Crushing Strength (3).

Only units Garrisoning an adjoining wall section can attack a unit Garrisoning a tower in Melee. Conversely, units Garrisoning a tower may attack enemy units Garrisoning adjoining wall sections. Units in wall sections may move through towers to Garrison, or charge units Garrisoning other adjoining wall sections. Units with Ranged attacks Garrisoning a tower may target enemy units in any direction. Draw line of sight and measure range from the centre of any of the tower’s facings. Units Garrisoning towers are always in cover from Ranged attacks, no matter the direction of the attacker.

Open Terrain simply describes the normal battlefield and it is assumed that units and warriors can move, see and fight in areas of Open Terrain easily, following the normal rules. You don’t need to specify Open Terrain – we assume it covers all the areas of your table where you have not placed any of the other terrain types listed below.

Il n'est pas nécessaire de spécifier le terrain dégagé – on suppose qu'il couvre toutes les zones de votre table où aucun autre type de terrain n’a été placé.

Each scenario will explain how to set up your games and what the victory conditions and special rules will be for each player. For tournament organisers, to encourage players to bring well balanced armies, we strongly recommend playing a variety of these scenarios at your events.

texts.value_en: Some spells have the target marked as ‘Friendly’. Such spells can only target Friendly units taken from the same list as the spellcaster with the spell. In other words, a spellcaster Primary Core unit may only target other Friendly Primary Core units, not Friendly Allied units and vice-versa: a spellcaster Allied Core unit can only target other Friendly Allied Core, not Friendly Primary Core units. Such spells can only target the spellcaster itself if ‘Self’ is listed in in the Targets section of the spell’s profile.

Some units have optional upgrades available, in which case the cost for the upgrade is listed beside the option in the unit profile. The total cost for a unit includes any upgrades selected for it. So if you chose a 15 point upgrade for a 100 point unit, the total cost of the unit would be 115 points.

texts.value_translated: Certaines unités possèdent des règles spéciales leur permettant d’être redéployées.

texts.value_en: Some units in the game have a value of “-” for their Wavering limit. For example, it could be -/14. These units are normally composed of fanatical, frenzied warriors or mindless supernatural creatures – in any case, they cannot Waver, and will therefore remain Steady until they eventually Rout. Of course a Rout result for such troops represents them being utterly annihilated, or collapsing as their magical life force abandons them.

texts.value_translated: Certaines unités possèdent ce que l'on appelle des ‘règles spéciales‘. Chacune de ces règles spéciales constitue une exception aux règles normales. Certaines sont listées avec les unités elles-mêmes, mais les plus courantes sont présentées ensemble dans cette section à titre de référence.

texts.value_translated: Parfois, les Héros ont des options qui leur permettent de choisir entre plusieurs montures. Si une monture est choisie, le type d’unité du Héros changera pour correspondre à celui de la monture concernée, comme spécifié dans la fiche du Héros.

If they only affect actions during specific phases, this will be listed in brackets after the special rule’s name in the unit entry. For instance, Elite (Ranged) grants the Elite special rule, but only on ranged attacks. In cases where there is no qualifier, the special rule works in all applicable phases.
texts.value_translated: Les règles spéciales accordent généralement des bonus ou appliquent des modificateurs aux jets de dés pendant la partie. Si elles n'affectent que des actions spécifiques à certaines phases, cela sera précisé entre parenthèses après le nom de la règle spéciale dans l'entrée de l'unité. Par exemple, Elite (Tir) accorde la règle spéciale Elite, mais uniquement pour les attaques à distance. texts.value_en: Terrain blocks LoS to any units behind it in the same way as a unit. For example, a Height 3 or higher building will block LoS between two Height 3 units. Some pieces of terrain, such as rivers and ponds, will be completely flat and never block LoS. As always, these should be agreed with your opponent before the game.
texts.value_translated: Le terrain bloque la ligne de vue vers toutes les unités situées derrière lui de la même manière qu'une unité. Par exemple, un bâtiment de taille 3 ou plus bloquera la ligne de vue entre deux unités de taille 3. Certaines pièces de terrain, comme les rivières et les étangs, seront complètement plates et ne bloqueront jamais la ligne de vue. Comme toujours, ces règles doivent être convenues avec votre adversaire avant la partie.

texts.value_en: Terrain does not block LoS drawn to units that are at least partially inside the piece of terrain. If any part of a unit is in a forest, for instance, then other units outside of the forest may draw LoS to the unit in the forest.
texts.value_translated: Le terrain ne bloque pas la ligne de vue vers les unités qui se trouvent partiellement à l'intérieur de la pièce de terrain. Par exemple, si une partie d'une unité est dans une forêt, les autres unités situées à l'extérieur de la forêt peuvent toujours tracer leur ligne de vue vers l'unité située à l'intérieur de la forêt.

texts.value_en: Terrain plays a vital role in Kings of War, providing cover from gunlines, breaking up charging paths for cavalry and providing strategic advantages and disadvantages for both players. Because terrain can have an effect on unit activity in all phases of the game, as well as LoS (and thus shooting), we will discuss it in more depth here before moving on to the Ranged and Melee phases.
texts.value_translated: Le terrain joue un rôle essentiel dans Kings of War, offrant un couvert contre les lignes de tir, perturbant les trajectoires de charge pour la cavalerie et apportant des avantages et des inconvénients stratégiques pour les deux joueurs. Étant donné que le terrain peut influencer l'activité des unités dans toutes les phases du jeu, ainsi que la ligne de vue (LdV) et donc les tirs, nous allons en discuter plus en détail ici avant de passer aux phases de Tir et de Mêlée.

The Attacker may choose one extra unit from their army list worth up to 200 points (including magical artefacts). Offensive Siege Equipment may be given to this unit in addition to the 200 point limit.

The Attacker may spend (up to) an extra 25% of their total points value on Offensive Siege Equipment and extra units. For example, a 2000 point army would be able to increase its total value to 2500. However the extra 500 points must be chosen from the Offensive Siege Equipment and extra units lists.

The Defender chooses an army list up to the points limit agreed by both players, which may contain items from the Defensive Siege Equipment list. The total amount spent by the Defender on these upgrades cannot exceed 25% of the agreed limit. Therefore in a 2000 point game, the Defender may choose up to 500 points worth of equipment as part of their 2000 point limit.

While Disengaging, if a unit begins its Turn Engaged with one or more Enemy units on a single facing only, it may make a free Withdraw move of 1”, directly away from the unit(s), before carrying out a Charge, Change Facing, Sidestep, Back, or Halt order. The Withdraw move cannot be used to come within 1” of any enemy units and the unit must travel the full 1”. If it is not possible to travel the full 1” or to maintain a 1” distance from all enemy units (including the unit(s) it was engaged with), then a unit may not make a Withdraw move.
texts.value_translated: Lors d'une Retraite, si une unité commence son tour engagée avec une ou plusieurs unités ennemies sur un seul côté seulement, elle peut effectuer un mouvement gratuit de Retraite de 1”, directement loin des unités ennemies, avant d'exécuter un ordre de Charge, Changement de Direction, Sur de Côté, En Arrière ou Halte. Le mouvement de Retraite ne peut pas être utilisé pour se rapprocher à moins de 1” d'une unité ennemie et l'unité doit parcourir les 1” complets. Si il est impossible de parcourir les 1” complets ou de maintenir une distance de 1” avec toutes les unités ennemies (y compris celles avec lesquelles elle était engagée), alors l'unité ne peut pas effectuer un mouvement de Retraite.

texts.value_translated: Lorsqu'une unité porte un jeton de butin, sa vitesse est réduite à 5 (à moins qu'elle ne soit déjà inférieure à 5) et elle ne peut pas être ciblée par les sorts Rafale de vent, Fascination ou Déferlement.
